Bilateral conductive hearing losses.context: Bilateral conductive hearing losses with right stapedial fixation secondary to otosclerosis.

right stapedial fixation.context: Bilateral conductive hearing losses with right stapedial fixation secondary to otosclerosis.

otosclerosis.context: Bilateral progressive conductive hearing losses with probable otosclerosis.

Bilateral progressive conductive hearing.context: Bilateral progressive conductive hearing losses with probable otosclerosis.

good mobility of both it and incus.context: Palpation of the malleus revealed good mobility of both it and incus, but no movement of the stapes was identified.

no movement of the stapes.context: Palpation of the malleus revealed good mobility of both it and incus, but no movement of the stapes was identified.

no movement.context: Palpation with a fine curved needle on the stapes itself revealed no movement.

trauma to the chorda tympani.context: A house curette was used to takedown portions of the scutum with extreme care to avoid any inadvertent trauma to the chorda tympani.

desiccation.context: The nerve was later hydrated with a small curved needle and an additional fluid to try to avoid inadvertent desiccation of it as well.

fenestration.context: The fenestration created in the footplate was nearly perfect for placement of the piston and therefore additional laser vaporization was not required in this particular situation.

postoperative drainage of perilymph.context: Small pledgets of fat were placed around the perimeter of the piston in an attempt to avoid any postoperative drainage of perilymph.
